fields.description:
Hello,

Now CVS integration requres ViewCVS server and have very unfriendly setup options.

If it possible, please make your service of statistic coverage, like TMate server (http://tmate.org/).

For setuping CVS Repositaries for project, you must just ask for CVS Root. But now, JIRA ask for any not understable parameters (why?).

For example, define CVS Root, ":pserver:user@server:/home", server of statistics must run rdiff tool and look for changes.

Thanks!
fields.summary: Smart and Easy CVS Integration

fields.description:
When a user is not logged in and tries to search in comment fields, the search fails (error message instead of search results) and I get the following exception in the log file:


2004-04-28 14:33:17,383 ERROR [web.action.issue.IssueNavigator] An error occurred searching: java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException
java.lang.reflect.UndeclaredThrowableException

fields.description: When searching for issues gives exactly 20 results, there is a first page containing all 20 issues and a second page containing no issue.
fields.summary: Find Issues gives empty second page

fields.description: Is it possible to script the creation of 'Project versions' from ant ?
fields.summary: JIRA Scripting ant task for version creation etc

fields.description:
In the "browse project" page, JIRA displays open issues, and in the linked-to filter, the criterion for whether an issue is open is whether it has a Resolution.  However in Mantis, issues can be closed without a resolution. When the Mantis importer imports closed/no resolution issues, these appear in the search for "open" issues.

If we wish to preserve the notion that all closed issues have a resolution, this can be fixed by automatically marking closed issues as "Fixed".  If we wish to emulate Mantis and allow closed/no resolution issues, we need a way of finding open issues that does not rely on Resolution.
fields.summary: Mantis importer creates closed issues without a resolution
JIRA Professional should not run with JIRA Enterprise license key

fields.description: When a user changes the date/time format in "Look and Feel" preferences, they are not respected in the notification e-mails. The problem is that the date/time formatter that is put into the velocity context is the hard coded SimpleDateFormat, not OutlookFormat that is used throgh out JIRA. The formatter is set in atlassian-velocity module.
fields.summary: Time/Date formats are not respected in notification e-mails

fields.description: Sort the Assign To pick list in alphabetical order, preferrably in the format surname, firstname.
fields.summary: Sort drop lists by alphabetical order.

fields.description:
When I filter issues to view, then click on the full content link, the text in the description field does not wrap and gets cut off when printing. 

Additionally, all the issues are printed one after another, not one per page. What am I doing wrong?
fields.summary: Full content will not print one issue per page

fields.description:
I've browsed API Javadoc for quite some time now and I've noticed that most components (types, methods, etc.) have no description whatsoever. It is nice to have an API to work with and its Javadoc to see method signatures, etc, but it is awfully useful to have descriptions.

Most of all, since GenericValue is used quite often, it would be useful to have minimal documentation about components (issue for example) representated with GenericValue (keys and mapped values description).

For now, the only way to know how to use the different GenericValue oriented components is to loop within keys and print value and key names.
fields.summary: API Javadoc incomplete

fields.description: It's a pain to move lots of issues to another project. Bulk move would ease...
fields.summary: Allow bulk move from project to project

fields.description: I would like to be able to specify that the number of working hours per day is 7.5 when using the Time Tracking feature.
fields.summary: Allow number of working hours per day to be in intervals of half an hour

fields.description: When moving an issue from a project without an issue security scheme to another project with a scheme, you cannot select the new level from the target projects security levels. The list only offers the source projects levels.
fields.summary: Move Issues uses wrong security levels

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3639].
  {panel}

In the 2.6.1 Pro version all the issues (when viewing the roadmap) is prsented in a "flat" list even though some of the issues are linked. However, in my opinion, it would be a greate visual improvement of you also could view the issue linking, ie, if a two issues are linked, the subisue is presented under the main task. Like this:


- Top issue 
  |
   -> Sub task
     |
      -> Sub sub task
fields.summary: Issue hierarchy

fields.description:
When creating an issue, there is no validation of Issue Type.

For some reason even though its a number, its stored in the database as a String. For starters, why is that?

Secondly, if you put some complete junk... like "asdjjklsadklsd" (possible via the jelly interface) then it duly shoves that in the database..... and voila, Jira doesnt know its dealing with anymore... and you cannot update/edit the issue.

The only workaround is to go to the jiraissue table, and fix it manually.

Having the db column as number would have caught this...
fields.summary: No validation of Issue Type!

fields.description:
When Jira is being re-indexed, the constistancy checker displays the following message:

"JIRA is currently being reindexed"

It would be better if the message gave more indication of this not being a "problem" - and that Jira will be automatically available once it is finished. There isnt much indication that this is an administrative activity and that users dont need to call support when it happens.

like:

"JIRA is currently being reindexed. Depending on how large the issue database is, this may take a few minutes. Jira will automatically become available as soon as this task is complete"
fields.summary: "JIRA is currently being reindexed "

fields.description: I've moved an issue from a project to another, but neither previous assignne nor new assignee has received a notification e-mail (and I think the reporter of the issue too).
fields.summary: No e-mail notification when moving an issue from a project to another

fields.description:
Allow user to decide if single/multiple attachments form is used.

Once single/multiple is selected, this choice is stored in the users session - the next time the attach form is accessed, the previous selection is in effect.
fields.summary: Allow user to decide if single/multiple attachments form is used.

fields.description: We currently use a DOM reader - we should use a sax based reader instead.
fields.summary: Decrease memory usage of XML backup / restore
Run CVS commits through JIRA to test for validity
Jira does not give warning or error message when disk space is full.

fields.description: It would be nice to have an option to hide the group list on the profile page (from other users). Our employees often work on many projects and clients should not have any clue about other projects than their own. We now patch the user_summary_pane.jsp with the diff below, but an option for it would save us the trouble. ;) @@ -36,7 +36,7 @@ - + :
fields.summary: Option to hide groups on the profile pages

fields.description:
When linking issues from the issues viewing page the user cannot browse to all issues in the process - only recently viewed issues are available for linking. This means that when a new issue pops up and I want to link it with a dependency to an older development request, I have to open a new browser window, brose to the other issue and find its key, copy, then return to browser window #1, paste.

Suggested solution:
 a link named "browse issues" that opens a small popup list of all issues in the project with only key and summary listed.

in the bottom of the list a link to "issues in other projects" that lead to a minimal project list.

best regards and thanks for a great tool.
fields.summary: Browse to issue while linking

fields.description:
When doing a full text search the wildcard operators * and ? don't work for strings containing non us characters (öäüÖÄÜß).

E.g.: A search for "Händler" gives 10 results. A Search for "Händler*" or "H?ndler" gives 0 results.
fields.summary: Wildcards in Search don't work with special characters

fields.description:
Please display a list of changed issues on the dashboad (project home) since you last logged in.

(see JRA-865 also)
fields.summary: Display changed items since I last logged in

fields.description: Bugzilla bugs can be set a "milestone", which roughly equates to a JIRA "fix for" version. The importer should preserve this information.
fields.summary: Bugzilla importer should set fix for version

fields.description:
In find issues i think it could be very interesting if user can select a matches versions filter even if no project is selected.

Actually this filter is only available if you select a specific project, because each project may have different version. But "released" and "unreleased" notions are common to all projects so if no project selected, the matches version filter can show only two options (released, unreleased).
fields.summary: released/unreleased version filter

fields.description: The rows are not highlighted, and there are no popups.
fields.summary: Javascript error when editing default dashboard

fields.description: The html head not include "<META http-equiv="Content-Type" content="text/html; charset=UTF-8">"
fields.summary: Content type is not set in popups

fields.description: JIRA's project keys are currently of the form [A-Z]{2,}, ie only uppercase letters.  It would be nice if numbers were also allowed.
fields.summary: Project keys should be allowed to contain numbers

fields.description: In the 2.7 Bugzilla importer, if a project key contains a '-', the error page is broken - it does not display the form the user was filling in, but an empty version of the previous page.
fields.summary: Bugzilla error screen does not repopulate fields
Validate email addresses of users who sign up

fields.description:
This can manifest itself in the fix for versions field often being blank, or containing issues from another project.

This is a simple JSP fix in edit_versions.jsp.
fields.summary: Fix for versions uses 'selected project' rather than the current issue's project

fields.description:
Jetbrains have added a version worklog report.

Let's see if we can add it into JIRA proper.
fields.summary: Version Workload report

fields.description:
It is currently not possible to grant additional permissions for a single user to a single issue.

This would be a very useful feature. Consider a JIRA user who has set up several issue security levels for one product, so that different customers of this product can only see their own issues, but not those of the other customers. 

It would be very helpful if the JIRA administrator could grant browse permission for one particular issue (belonging to customer A) to one particular person belonging to customer B. The person could then find out whether this information is relevant do him. But he could not see any additional customer A issues, and no other person of customer B has any additional permissions.

Another scenario: a user who is not a developer attaches a patch or some source code to an issue. It would be useful to grant this person some developer related permissions to this issue only, since he is the one currently working on this. 

The perfect solution is to have an extra control which works exactly like the existing "Add User/Group to Issue Security Level" or "Add New Permission" control, but which operates on a single issue instead on a security level or a permission scheme.
fields.summary: Override issue permissions for one person

fields.description:
Subject says it all.

In addition, from a user:

we use jira 2.6.1 and discovered some problems with german "umlauts"
when exporting issues to XML which have some german "umlauts" in one of
the custom fields.
See the error attached.
                                                                                                                                                             
Cheers,
Stefan
                                                                                                                                                             
XML Parsing Error: undefined entity "uuml"
Location:
http://jira:9980/secure/IssueNavigator.jspa?view=rss&pid=10000&types=7&sorter/field=issuekey&sorter/order=DESC&tempMax=25&reset=true&decorator=none
Line Number 126, Column 77:
fields.summary: XML export uses HTML escaping instead of XML escaping, which causes problems

fields.description:
Occasionally a mail message rather than becoming a comment, it goes into the ether.
see (CSP-21).

It would be nice to have unknown mail go to location where it can be browsed, and associated with an issue. 

Otherwise you never know that a user responded to an issue, and that it was just mis-parsed.
fields.summary: Send mail for unknown issues to a store so it can be reviewed

fields.description:
Custom portlet, which displays the open unestimated issues, encounters the following error:

'Indexing is currently not configured so no issue
searching can be performed.'

The custom portlet reuses the issuesummary.jsp. The error is still encountered if the data is re-indexed.

There is a condition in the jsp for:

 if(indexing == true)

- with this condition removed, the error message is encountered.
fields.summary: Custom 'Unestimated Issues' portlet encounters indexing error.

fields.description: It would be trivial to make one extend the other.
fields.summary: Remove duplicate code in FullComment & NonQuotedComment Handlers

fields.description:
Can't find something.
なんか表示がおかしいようです。
fields.summary: Can't find something

fields.description:
Currently (version 2.6.1) I can't seem to get a good printable view of an issue. Is the printable decorator busted for viewing issues?

for example : http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRA-3454?decorator=printable

Using the printable decorator here doesn't help the user much.

Furthermore, an improvement could be to have a printable view of an issue without displaying any of the menus on the left of the screen, currently being the following:

"Issue details",  "Available workflow actions" and "Operations".

Could we have an option to hide these (or automatically hide these in the printable decorator)?

This way the user can immediately get a simple print out of an issue without wasting too much paper on menus etc.

Thanks.
fields.summary: Printable view of an issue

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3609].
  {panel}

{panel:title=Atlassian Update – 4 January 2016|borderStyle=solid|borderColor=#ebf2f9 | titleBGColor=#ebf2f9 | bgColor=#ffffff}
Hi everyone,

Thanks for voting and commenting on this issue. Your feedback is key to helping us understand how you use JIRA so we can continue improving your experience. We have reviewed this issue over the last few days; unfortunately we don't have any plans to support this in JIRA for the foreseeable future. Please follow the [documentation available here|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/JIRA/Customizing+Email+Content] for workarounds. 

Please remember that jira.atlassian.com is one of many inputs for the JIRA roadmap. You can [learn more about our process here|https://answers.atlassian.com/questions/110373/how-does-the-jira-team-use-jira-atlassian-com].
 
I understand that our decision may be disappointing. Please don't hesitate to contact me if you have any questions.
 
Regards,
Dave Meyer
dmeyer@atlassian.com
Product Manager, JIRA Platform
{panel}

*Original request description*
 
Currently, it is not possible to customize the subject line for notifications.
 
At present it is something like:
{noformat}[prefix] action: (project key) summary{noformat}
 
Perhaps a new feature could be to customize what order 'prefix', 'action','project' and 'summary' appear in. This could be done by providing the subject line as a velocity template that we can manually edit.
fields.summary: Customize mail subject line

fields.description:
When I create a new bug with my evaluation installation, I select a "Due date" with the Date picker.

Unfortunately, the inserted date i.e. 29-Apr-2004 seems to be incorrect. The awaited format should be "d-MMM-yyyy"????

Thanks for your help, we plan to buy your software,...

Eric.
fields.summary: Due date error after selection with calendar

fields.description:
We need the ability to display a project's issue statistics similar to the portlet that jira already has but we would like to have the ability set a filter so that it only shows the statistics broken down by issue type.

For example we want to only show the statistics for 'bugs' in the system.
fields.summary: Provide Statistics Portlet that can use an Issue Type as a filter

fields.description: It is possible to configure the Protlets, particularly the "Assigned To Me" can modify the number of displayed items. Unfortunately there is no obvious order in the displayed items. I would expect that is feasible enough to add a way to specify the order as a parameter to the portlet(s). (order by due-date is what i need most, but order by reporter, order by alphabet might make sense as well)
fields.summary: order of "Assigned To Me" Protlet

fields.description:
This is because we cast Field to CompositeField, and when we use proxying, this throws an error.

The problem is CompositeComponentNavigableFieldImpl line 25:

return (CompositeField) ManagerFactory.getFieldManager().getField(parentId);

We should probably change that manager to return a composite field.
fields.summary: Enabling profiling kills the issue navigator columns

fields.description: We might want to fix up the support page also.
fields.summary: Error page in JIRA should point to new support system

fields.description: Make the preset filters of the BrowseProject page selectable in the IssueNavigator. There is enough place under the "Summary" on the left site.
fields.summary: Show standard filters in the IssueNavigator

fields.description:
The thumbnail does not appear when i use the "atach screenshot" feature.

The image link to this directory:
http://jira.xxxx:9091/secure/attachment//
fields.summary: Image Atachments

fields.description:
Steps:
1. Find Issues
2. Selecting 'Specify User' in 'Reported By:'
3. Clicking 'Select a user' icon
4. In 'User Picker' selecting some group in 'In Group:' combo and pressing 'Filter' button
Users list shown containing more than one page
5. Clicking '2' or 'Next >>' below the list

RESULT: I get the selected group above lost. The combo is switched to 'Any' and as result I see the 2nd page but not the one I expected.
fields.summary: User Picker loses "In Group:" state when changing page in paginator
Ability to add a description to an attachment (instead of a comment?)

fields.description:
We are getting serveral errors by precompiling the jsp pages for BEA Weblogic 8.1:


Error: [jspc]: 6 file(s) failed: 
 /includes/decorators/helplink.jsp 
 /includes/js/history.jsp 
 /includes/js/savedfilters.jsp 
 /includes/decorators/headerpopups.jsp 
 /includes/decorators/bodytop.jsp 
 /includes/dashboard/projects.jsp 
Exception in thread "main" Errors encountered while compiling  'weblogic' : 

Translation of /includes/dashboard/projects.jsp failed: (line 11): no corresponding open tag for tag extension close: </webwork:property>       //[ null; Line:11]

For more information see jira mailing list.


BEA support investigated the problem and found out:
- f.e. projects.jsp is causing the error in the lines 10, 19 und 33.
- the included JSPs define the webwork taglib <%@ taglib uri="webwork" prefix="webwork" %> AGAIN ! This is the problem:

The pseudo code looks like this:

<%@ taglib uri="webwork" prefix="webwork" %>
    <webwork:property value="/projectManager/projectCategory(property('projectcategoryid'))">
       
       // double taglib declaration in the include:
       <%@ taglib uri="webwork" prefix="webwork" %>
                <webwork:iterator value="browseableProjectsInCategory(.)">
                    <jsp:include page="/includes/dashboard/project.jsp"/>
                </webwork:iterator>

    </webwork:property>


- According to JSP Spec. 2.10.2: "It is a fatal translation error for the taglib directive to appear after actions using the prefix."

==>

- to allow compiling you have to correct all static included JSPs (noprojects.jsp, categorisedprojects.jsp, ...) and you have to remove the redeclaration (<%@ taglib uri="webwork" prefix="webwork" %>)
fields.summary: Correct static jsp includes to allow for Weblogic precompilation
Merging of issues

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3591].
  {panel}

It does not make sense that one gets notifications of every change of an issue. And it is even less reasonable that someone who creates or changes an issue that is assigned to himself gets notifications of the changes he made by himself.

Sometimes one would like to inform the reporter (or someone else) about the changes.

Therefore it would be helpful to have a function allowing to send notifications about the issue currently edited.

Function: Notify
-> dialogue to select users
-> email is send as usual
fields.summary: Notification of certain users when issues change

fields.description:
After deleting a security level in a certain security scheme none of the issues that have been assigned to the deleted level can be found anymore. (The 'delete' dialogue does not show any of the remaining levels. Due to this the only level that can be selected is 'None'.)

We have found only one way to correct this problem: We set the security scheme of all project with missing issues to 'None' and after that to the correct security level again. Unfortunately all security levels we set before are set to one single security level afterwards.
fields.summary: Problem with deleting security levels in issue security schemes

fields.description:
When moving an issue from one project to another the security level is not handled correctly.

a) The combo box shows the right number of entries, but except the first one ('None') these entries are empty. (The project where the issue belongs to has four different security levels, the project where the issue shall be moved to has no security level.)

b) If a security level has been selected 'blindly', the name of the security level is correct in the following form, but the label for the entry reads 'fixes version'.

After moving the issue, the security level is correct when selected 'blindly'.
fields.summary: Security problems with moving an issue from one project to another

fields.description:
CVS integration throws java.lang.OutOfMemoryError if one of the filenames has e.g. scandinavian letters like o with double dots and Tomcat has been started so that environement variable LANG has been set as:
LANG=C
or 
LANG=en_US.UTF-8 (default in e.g. Fedora Core 1 and Redhat 9 !)

This one works ok:
LANG=en_US

Simply created one directory (module) into CVS(NT) with one file
test/työ.txt (ty\366.txt)
and then checked it out locally as:
/opt/jira_cvs/test

What happens in the checked out CVS directory when Jira 2.6.1 Pro will be pointed to it is:
--------------------------------------------------------

Tomcat started with: export LANG=C

[root@svxteam test]# pwd
/opt/jira_cvs/test
[root@svxteam test]# ls -lab
total 252
drwxr-xr-x    3 root     root         4096 Apr 16 11:04 .
drwxr-xr-x    7 root     root       237568 Apr 16 11:01 ..
drwxr-xr-x    2 root     root         4096 Apr 16 11:04 CVS
-rw-r--r--    1 root     root           46 Apr 16 10:57 ty?.txt

(? is truly a questions mark here!)
==> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
--------------------------------------------------------

Tomcat started with: export LANG=en_US.UTF-8

[root@svxteam test]# ls -lab
total 248
drwxr-xr-x    3 root     root         4096 Apr 16 11:26 .
drwxr-xr-x    7 root     root       237568 Apr 16 11:01 ..
drwxr-xr-x    2 root     root         4096 Apr 16 11:26 CVS
-rw-r--r--    1 root     root           46 Apr 16 10:57 ty\357\277\275.txt

==> java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
--------------------------------------------------------

Tomcat started with: export LANG=en_US

[root@svxteam test]# ls -lab
total 248
drwxr-xr-x    3 root     root         4096 Apr 16 11:19 .
drwxr-xr-x    7 root     root       237568 Apr 16 11:01 ..
drwxr-xr-x    2 root     root         4096 Apr 16 11:19 CVS
-rw-r--r--    1 root     root           46 Apr 16 10:57 ty\366.txt

==> ok !
--------------------------------------------------------

Debug log when running out of memory:

--- catalina.out ---
...
2004-04-16 11:31:00,103 INFO [jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl] Starting cvs update.
Server is not supporting gzip-file-contents request
2004-04-16 11:31:00,172 INFO [jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl] Finished cvs update.
2004-04-16 11:31:00,172 INFO [jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl] Starting log
Server is not supporting gzip-file-contents request
2004-04-16 11:31:00,232 INFO [jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl] Finished log.
2004-04-16 11:31:00,232 DEBUG [jira.vcs.cvsimpl.CvsRepositoryUtilImpl] Cvs log took 60ms
2004-04-16 11:31:15,301 ERROR [action.admin.vcs.RepositoryTest] Error occurred while updating the cvs repository, obtaining cvs log or parsing the cvs log.
java.lang.OutOfMemoryError
...
--- catalina.out ---

Even running with these values won't help:
/opt/j2sdk1.4.2_04/bin/java -Xms1500m -Xmx1500m ...
As seen with 'top' JVM will grow to about 1.5GB and then run out of memory with: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError

And happens also with CVS 1.11.2 as server on another host
fields.summary: CVS integration: java.lang.OutOfMemoryError if filename has scandinavian letters, LANG=en_US.UTF-8

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3570].
  {panel}

I'd like a way to easily filter all the issues which have patches associated with them. I've not figured out how to do this.

Use case: you're working on a busy open source project and folks submit many issues. However the ones where folks submit a patch too - should be higher priority since someone else has already gone to the trouble of fixing your issue :)

A simple way of doing it is to allow a new field on the filter screen allowing attachments to be filtered out. Or adding a new column 'attachments y/n' to the tabular view of issues.

Unless there's a clever way to do this now already?
fields.summary: Easy way to filter all issues with attachments (patches)

fields.description: Serge K. recommended i submit this request. I have built project tracking systems that follow one of my core principles of building hierarchical lists of features (or issues). Jira currently allows me to create a new issue type (like "Feature Set" -- which is good). Jira allows me to (albeit laboriously) assign (link) a new issue to the Feature Set. However, I cannot easily see my Features (issues) listed underneath the Feature Set. Or, if an Issue is linked to other issues, the same need exists: let me view an issue and any sub-issue. I realize you can see these relationships in "full mode" -- but I want to see them in a nested, tabular report format. I would not even care if you just did a simple table with repeated data (i.e., the Feature Set column shows repeated data for each sub-feature). I can explain further, if needed. I have other requests i could submit as well, if you are interested.
fields.summary: Improved use of nested (linked) issues

fields.description: I would like to be able to easily scan the subject of a mail from JIRA and know the priority of the issue.  That way, you can act immediately on important notifications.

fields.description:
{panel:bgColor=#e7f4fa}
  *NOTE:* This suggestion is for *JIRA Server*. Using *JIRA Cloud*? [See the corresponding suggestion|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/JRACLOUD-3555].
  {panel}

In breaking down the set of issues to chunks the user needs to look at the following facilities exist:

1. Filters allow to restrict the issue set retrieved
2. Navigator config allows to customise the info fields displayed
3. Sorting allows to order the set 

What is missing is grouping.  

Users don't like 
- constantly changing the filter nor
- choosing from a large set of filters nor 
- large result sets (only the 1st screen-full is really looked at)
Grouping solves these issues by structuring the result set into digestible subsets of items. 

Notes:
A. the groups should appear as 'table-of-content' links on the 1st (new) navigator screen, the user can then drill into these subsets that are displayed exactly as the current navigator screens 
B. applying grouping may cause an issue to appear twice for multi-value fields (which is absolutely the expected behaviour)
C. grouping could even total numeric fields (e.g. time tracking)
D. This also solves the issue of not being able to sort on multi-valued fields (you simply group by them).
E. The column(s) to group by may be selectable in much the same way as to sort by.
fields.summary: Add issue grouping in navigator filters

fields.description:
It would be extremely useful for us to have the ability to multi-select projects when setting up a filter.

This is particularly relevant when you want a list of all high-priority issues across 5 related projects.  Another useful one is to see all issues assigned to yourself across multiple projects.  These would be my two default filters on my dashboard if I could get them. 

Using ALL projects doesn't quite fit, as there are a number of projects I specifically want to exclude.
fields.summary: Filter to include multiple projects
